titleStmt.title: Marleborovves miseries, or England turned Ireland, by the [brace] Lord Digby and Daniel Oneale. Reade and iudge, this being a most exact and a true relation of the besieging plundering pillaging and burning part of the said towne. / Written by T.B. W.B. O.B. J.H. who were not only spectators, but also sufferers in that most unchristian action. Dedicated to all England, and directed to the city of London, to shew the abuse of the subjects, liberty, and priviledges of their owne goods.
titleStmt.author: T. B.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by one that prints the truth,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
